title: 104_hr3998
content: The "Citizen Debt Reduction Contribution Act" includes provisions for citizens to donate income tax refunds, social security benefits, military retirement benefits, and veterans' disability compensation to reduce the Federal deficit. Congress acknowledges the contributions of citizens and emphasizes that budget savings should be used to reduce Government spending. SEC. 3. INCOME TAX REFUNDS. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow the designation of income tax overpayments to reduce public debt. Taxpayers can designate a portion of their tax overpayment to reduce the public debt of the United States. The designation must be made at the time of filing the tax return and will be treated as a refund to the taxpayer. Taxpayers can designate a portion of their tax overpayment to reduce the public debt of the United States, to be transferred by the Secretary of the Treasury to a special account for deficit reduction. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1995. Taxpayers can also donate a portion of their Social Security benefits to reduce the federal deficit. The Social Security Act is amended to allow recipients of monthly insurance benefits to elect to transfer a portion of their benefits to the Treasury as a gift to reduce the public debt. This program applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 1995. The Social Security Act allows recipients of monthly insurance benefits to transfer a portion of their benefits to the Treasury as a gift to reduce the public debt. Amounts transferred are not taxable income and cannot be deducted on tax returns. SEC. 5. Donation of military retirement benefits for purposes of reducing the federal deficit. Chapter 71 of title 10, United States Code, is amended to allow members or former members of the armed forces to donate a portion of their retired or retainer pay to the Treasury as a gift to reduce the public debt. The Secretary of the Treasury is authorized to accept these donations. The amendment allows members of the armed forces to donate a portion of their retired pay to reduce the public debt. Amounts subject to this election are not taxable under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. SEC. 6. Veterans can donate disability compensation to reduce federal deficit. Veterans can elect to donate a portion of their compensation to the Treasury to reduce the public debt. The Secretary of the Treasury can accept these donations as gifts. Amounts donated are not taxable income. Veterans can elect to donate a portion of their compensation to reduce the public debt. Donated amounts are not taxable income and no deductions are allowed for these donations under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Veterans can donate a portion of their compensation to reduce the public debt. Savings resulting from this Act will not be considered for budget estimates under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985.
